question_text: How does APIPA differ from a static IP address?
answer_options: Static IPs change every boot, APIPA does not
APIPA addresses are assigned automatically after DHCP failure
Static IPs only work on IPv6 networks
correct_answer: APIPA addresses are assigned automatically after DHCP failure
explanation: APIPA addresses are self-assigned dynamically, whereas static IPs are manually configured by the user.
